stories.text:
Some popular desktop apps that still don't expire:

- Affinity apps (Designer, Photo, Publisher)

- Sublime Text

- Davinci Resolve (video editor and tools)

Struggling to think of more apps. In contrast, the subscription model has conquered many desktop apps.

Which desktop apps still don't expire?

(Note: desktop apps that don't expire charge for upgrades. If users decide not to upgrade, they can continue using the app.)
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there any desktop apps that haven't moved to a subscription model?

Smartphones will kill off the DSLR within three years says Sony
Elon Musk on Cybertruck, “it will be our best product ever imo”
Interactive data exploration utilities with dimensionality reduction and D3.js

Hector Martin (from Asahi Linux) about Rosetta not using proprietary M1 features

stories.text:
I work at a consultant company. My project and work is with the client.

Currently, we are developing an awesome project at my client side. Whenever we (client) officially share info on our project, I will forward the same to my colleagues in my consultant company (in Slack channel). It is a great project and I am very excited to share that. But no one in my consultant company usually responds (appreciate/suggest) to my message. It is an active channel and I see reactions to other messages.

It could be something or nothing, but I am interested in what makes people behave like that.

Please share if you have any theory or research to this or similar situations.
stories.title: Why colleagues don't respond to your message when you share your awesome project
